page.title: 04ARCHITECTURE IN HOLBERROW GN
page.content:
A small proportion remain un-white-washed and present a pale red brick exterior. Some retain their thatched roof.
Black and white buildings appear frequently. Most of these date back to 16th + 17th centuries and old building methods have been revealed inside the cottages during modernisation. Several farmhouses were built at least 150 years ago. A few were timber framed, for example PINHILLS FARM but most were brick built and now all their roofs are tiled and windows enlarged.
